content.question:
An agricultural engineer selected a random sample of <math alttext="30" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> farms in the United States to construct a <math alttext="95" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent confidence interval for the mean size, in acres, of farms in the United States. The resulting interval was <math alttext="open parenthesis, 367 comma 558, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>367</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>558</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Which of the following is an appropriate interpretation of the <math alttext="95" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent confidence level?

choices.label: Approximately <math alttext="95%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> of the farm sizes in the sample are between <math alttext="367" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>367</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> acres and <math alttext="558" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>558</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> acres.

Approximately <math alttext="95%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> of all farm sizes in the United States are between <math alttext="367" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>367</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> acres and <math alttext="558" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>558</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> acres.

Approximately <math alttext="95%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> of all random samples of size <math alttext="30" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> from the population will have a mean farm size between <math alttext="367" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>367</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> acres and <math alttext="558" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>558</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> acres.

Approximately <math alttext="95%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> of all random samples of size <math alttext="30" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> from the population will produce intervals that contain the mean size of farms in the United States.

Approximately <math alttext="95%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> of all random samples of size <math alttext="30" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> from the population will produce intervals that contain the sample mean.

content.answer: Approximately <math alttext="95%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> of all random samples of size <math alttext="30" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> from the population will produce intervals that contain the mean size of farms in the United States.

topic.text: 7.3: Justifying a Claim About a Population Mean Based on a Confidence Interval

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
